question: Which of the following showed the greatest uniformity in Indus Valley Civilization settlements?
explanation: The greatest uniformity is noticed in the layouts of the towns, streets, structures, brick size, drains, etc. Almost all the major sites (Harappa, Mohenjodaro, Kalibangan and others) are divided into two partsâ€“a citadel on higher mound on the western side and a lower town on the eastern side of the Indus Valley Civilization settlement.
